Historical

Biography

Career Statistics

AT ILLINOIS WESLEYAN: Earned four letters for the IWU Volleyball team (2009, 2010, 2011, 2012)...Earned four letters for softball as well (2010, 2011, 2012, 2013)...

She finished her Titan career tied for fourth all-time in stolen bases with 54...She also ranks sixth all-time for most games played in a Titan uniform with 169...

2013: Played in 38 games and started in 14 for the Titans...Had a .415 batting average with 27 hits in 65 at bats...Had 31 runs scored had was 6-7 in stolen base attempts...

2012: Played in all 46 games and started 39...Batted .333, scored 27 runs, had seven RBI and was 15-for-17 on steal attempts...Also had a .432 on base percentage...

2011: Played in all 36 games and started 35 as the Titans leadoff hitter...Batted .274 (31-113), scored 29 runs, had five RBI and was 13-for-16 on steal attempts...

2010: Was named College Conference of Illinois & Wisconsin "Player of the Week" on March 23 as she batted .345 (10-for-29), scored five runs, walked twice and stole three bases in eight games March 15-20...

HIGH SCHOOL: Earned four letters in volleyball and four more in softball (centerfielder) at Nazareth Academy and was the school's "Female Athlete of the Year" as a senior...Honorable mention Suburban Life all-area in both sports...Was volleyball team captain...Earned "Roadrunner Award" in both sports...

PERSONAL: Stephanie E. Polich...Born February 4, 1991...Majoring in accounting at Illinois Wesleyan...Parents are Rudy and Carol Polich.
